channel.title: The Relationship Between News Consumption and Federal Election Interest
channel.description: Recent content on The Relationship Between News Consumption and Federal Election Interest

item.title: The Relationship Between News Consumption and Federal Election Interest
item.description: Author: Alen Mitrovski Abstract In this paper, I looked into the distributions of news consumption and election interest in the 2015 Canadian Election Study. Using R, I was able to graph these results and examine their distributive properties. I hypothesized that the distributions of news consumption and interest in the federal election will both be right skewed. As a result of examining the graphs, I concluded that the distribution of federal election interest was right skewed, whereas, the distribution of news consumption followed a normal distribution.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
